alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 8:06PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, Knox and southern Clay Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Haven, or 10 miles south of Manchester, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Haven around 810 PM EDT. Sprule and Tedders around 815 PM EDT. Hammond, Salt Gum and Gibbs around 820 PM EDT. Fount and Fletcher around 825 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Cranes Nest, Scalf, Knoxfork, Green Road, Barbourville, Girdler, Hinkle, Cannon, Bimble, Barnyard, Yeager, Jarvis, Baughman and Baileys Switch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
